p: For reptiles, 22 of the 88 families were included in the reviewed studies, representing 1.5% of all described reptilian species ( tableÂ 1 and electronic supplementary material, table S6). The most species-rich family, the Scincidae (skinks) with 1589 species, was represented by only 11 species. Other species-rich families such as the Agamidae and Dactyloidae (anoles) were not investigated by any of the reviewed studies (electronic supplementary material, table S6).
